members.member: In order to allow enumerables to not pre-compute/copy all elements, this ctor allows injecting and therefore re-using the caching elements. An enumerable like can then issue multiple Enumerators while the same cache is filled when advancing them.

member.name: T:Yaapii.Atoms.IInput
member.summary:
Input.
Here is for example how can be used in order to read the content of a text file:
String content = new BytesAsText( new InputAsBytes( new InputOf(new Uri("file:///C:/tmp/names.txt") ) ).asString();
Here implements and behaves like one, providing read-only access to the encapsulated pointing to a file.

member.name: T:Yaapii.Atoms.IKvp
member.summary: A key-value pair string to string to add to a map.

member.name: T:Yaapii.Atoms.IKvp`1
member.summary: A key-value pair to add to a map.

member.name: T:Yaapii.Atoms.IKvp`2
member.summary: A key-value pair to add to a map.

members.member:
Output.
Here is for example how can be used together with in order to modify the content of a text file:
new LengthOfInput( new TeeInput( new InputOf(new StringAsText("Hello, world!")), new OutputTo(new Uri("file:///C:/tmp/names.txt")) ) ).AsValue();
Here implements {@link Output} and behaves like one, providing write-only access to the encapsulated . The copies the content of the input to the output. The calculates the size of the copied data.
There is no thread-safety guarantee.
